API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.x trunk

sandy.core.SceneLocator

type
class
version
3.1
The SceneLocator serves as a registry of all scenes in the application.

An application can only have one SceneLocator. Using the SceneLocator, scenes can be located, registered, and unregistered.

When scenes are created in an application, they automatically register with the SceneLocator registry.

Static Methods

getInstance() : SceneLocator

returns
The single locator
Returns a SceneLocator.

Constructor

new(access : PrivateConstructorAccess)
parameters
access A singleton access flag object
Creates the SceneLocator registry

This constructor is never called directly.
Instead you get the registry instance by calling SceneLocator.getInstance().

Instance Methods

getScene(key : String) : Scene3D

parameters
key The name of the scene
returns
The requested scene
Returns the Scene3D object with the specified name.

isRegistered(key : String) : Bool

parameters
key The Name of the scene to check
returns
true if a scene with that name is registered, false otherwise
Check if a scene with the specified name is registered.

registerScene(key : String, o : Scene3D) : Bool

parameters
key : String, name of the scene to register
o : Scene3D, object to register
returns
true if the registration was successful, false otherwise
Registers a scene with this SceneLocator

unregisterScene(key : String) : Void

parameters
key Th name of the scene to unregister
Unregisters a scene with the specified name
